title: What's a good way for me to play a VHS tape if I don't own a VCR? - Quora

response.answer_text: What's a good way for me to play a VHS tape if I don't own a VCR? You do not have one. How do you want to play a video cassette without the video cassette player? You have only two options. Either borrow one from a friend or buy one. Well… you can always try to find a VCR rental store. VCR Player rental I am sure you will have a great difficulty finding one but, who knows, maybe you are lucky and you have one just around the corner. How do VHS players work?

They make an adapter that will make VHS-C tapes playable in a regular VCR.  Or they did.... it looks like a VHS tape, and you insert the VHS-C.  If you can find one, use that to play the tape on a regular VCR.  You can buy a VCR at Goodwill for next to nothing.  Another thought is to put an ad on Craigslist and offer someone 5 bucks to use their player.  I realize this answer probably doesn't meet your urgent need, based on the date of your post.

Buy a DVD-VHS combo unit. Can be found for cheap on ebay. https://www.ebay.com/itm/Magnavox-MWD2205-DVD-VCR-Combo-Player-VHS-Video-Cassette-Recorder/254129286404?epid=1101520931&hash=item3b2b492d04:g:6jMAAOSw0q1cak-8:rk:1:pf:0
